subject: Personal Finance
title: Price Discrimination
description: Learn Price Discrimination in one minute.

hook.text: Two passengers on the same flight paid $200 and $800 for the same seat. Both prices are 'fair.'

buildup.text: Price discrimination charges different prices for the same product based on willingness to pay.

discovery.text: Student discounts, senior pricing, and early-bird specials are all forms of price discrimination.

twist.text: Online retailers use your browsing data to show personalized prices. Same product, different person, different price.

climax.text: It's often legal and economically efficient. But it raises deep fairness questions about who pays more and why.

punchline.text: The same product can have many fair prices.

quiz.question: What is price discrimination?
options: Charging different prices for the same product based on the buyer
Charging unfair prices to all customers
